lemma quadraticHalfLinear_translate_sub_of_dotProduct_symmetric {n : Nat} (Q : (Fin n Real) [] (Fin n Real)) (hQsymm : x y : Fin n Real, (Q x) y = x Q y) : a x : Fin n Real, quadraticHalfLinear n Q (x - a) = quadraticHalfLinear n Q x + ((x (-Q a) : Real) : EReal) + (((1 / 2 : Real) * (a Q a) : Real) : EReal) := by classical intro a x -- Work in `Real`, then coerce to `EReal`. have hax : (a Q x : Real) = (x Q a : Real) := by calc (a Q x : Real) = (Q x a : Real) := by simp [dotProduct_comm] _ = (x Q a : Real) := by simpa using (hQsymm x a) have h_expand : (x - a) Q (x - a) = (x Q x : Real) - 2 * (x Q a : Real) + (a Q a : Real) := by calc (x - a) Q (x - a) = (x Q x : Real) - (x Q a : Real) - (a Q x : Real) + (a Q a : Real) := by simp [sub_eq_add_neg, add_dotProduct, dotProduct_add, map_add, map_neg, add_assoc, add_comm, add_left_comm] _ = (x Q x : Real) - 2 * (x Q a : Real) + (a Q a : Real) := by nlinarith [hax] have hreal : (1 / 2 : Real) * ((x - a) Q (x - a) : Real) = (1 / 2 : Real) * (x Q x : Real) - (x Q a : Real) + (1 / 2 : Real) * (a Q a : Real) := by rw [h_expand] ring have hE : (((1 / 2 : Real) * ((x - a) Q (x - a)) : Real) : EReal) = (((1 / 2 : Real) * (x Q x) : Real) : EReal) + ((x (-Q a) : Real) : EReal) + (((1 / 2 : Real) * (a Q a) : Real) : EReal) := by -- Coerce the real identity into `EReal` and rewrite `-(x Q a)` as `x (-Q a)`. have hxneg : (x (-Q a) : Real) = -(x Q a : Real) := by simp [dotProduct] have hE' : (((1 / 2 : Real) * ((x - a) Q (x - a)) : Real) : EReal) = (((1 / 2 : Real) * (x Q x) : Real) : EReal) + ((-(x Q a) : Real) : EReal) + (((1 / 2 : Real) * (a Q a) : Real) : EReal) := by exact_mod_cast hreal simpa [hxneg, add_assoc, add_left_comm, add_comm] using hE' simpa [quadraticHalfLinear, add_assoc, add_left_comm, add_comm] using hE

Convexity of the square function: lies below the chord between Unknown identifier `a`sorry ^ 2 : ?m.6a^2 and Unknown identifier `b`sorry ^ 2 : ?m.6b^2 for Unknown identifier `t`sorry [0, 1] : Propt [0,1].

lemma sq_segment_le (a b t : Real) (ht0 : 0 t) (ht1 : t 1) : ((1 - t) * a + t * b) ^ 2 (1 - t) * (a ^ 2) + t * (b ^ 2) := by have h : 0 t * (1 - t) * (a - b) ^ 2 := by have : 0 t * (1 - t) := by nlinarith exact mul_nonneg this (sq_nonneg (a - b)) -- Expand and simplify. nlinarith [h]

A weighted diagonal quadratic function with nonnegative weights is a proper convex function on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n.

lemma properConvexFunctionOn_diagonalQuadratic {n : Nat} (d : Fin n Real) (hd : i : Fin n, 0 d i) : ProperConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) (fun x => (((1 / 2 : Real) * ( i : Fin n, d i * (x i) ^ 2) : Real) : EReal)) := by classical let q : (Fin n Real) EReal := fun x => (((1 / 2 : Real) * ( i : Fin n, d i * (x i) ^ 2) : Real) : EReal) have hnotbot : x (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)), q x ( : EReal) := by intro x hx simpa [q] using (EReal.coe_ne_bot ((1 / 2 : Real) * ( i : Fin n, d i * (x i) ^ 2) : Real)) have hconv : ConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) q := by refine (convexFunctionOn_iff_segment_inequality (C := Set.univ) (f := q) (hC := convex_univ) (hnotbot := hnotbot)).2 ?_ intro x hx y hy t ht0 ht1 -- Reduce to a real inequality. have ht0' : 0 t := le_of_lt ht0 have ht1' : t 1 := le_of_lt ht1 have hsq : i : Fin n, ((1 - t) * x i + t * y i) ^ 2 (1 - t) * (x i) ^ 2 + t * (y i) ^ 2 := by intro i simpa [mul_assoc, mul_left_comm, mul_comm] using sq_segment_le (a := x i) (b := y i) (t := t) ht0' ht1' have hterm : i : Fin n, d i * (((1 - t) * x i + t * y i) ^ 2) d i * ((1 - t) * (x i) ^ 2 + t * (y i) ^ 2) := by intro i exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left (hsq i) (hd i) have hsum : i : Fin n, d i * (((1 - t) * x i + t * y i) ^ 2) i : Fin n, d i * ((1 - t) * (x i) ^ 2 + t * (y i) ^ 2) := by exact Finset.sum_le_sum (fun i hi => hterm i) have hsum' : i : Fin n, d i * ((1 - t) * (x i) ^ 2 + t * (y i) ^ 2) = (1 - t) * ( i : Fin n, d i * (x i) ^ 2) + t * ( i : Fin n, d i * (y i) ^ 2) := by -- Distribute and factor. simp [mul_add, Finset.sum_add_distrib, Finset.mul_sum, mul_assoc, mul_left_comm, mul_comm] have hreal : (1 / 2 : Real) * ( i : Fin n, d i * (((1 - Translating the input preserves proper convexity on Set.univ.{u} { : Type u} : Set Set.univ.

lemma properConvexFunctionOn_translate {n : Nat} (a : Fin n Real) {f : (Fin n Real) EReal} (hf : ProperConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) f) : ProperConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) (fun x => f (x - a)) := by classical have hnotbot : x (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)), f (x - a) ( : EReal) := by intro x hx exact hf.2.2 (x - a) (by simp) have hconv : ConvexFunctionOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) (fun x => f (x - a)) := by -- Use the segment inequality characterization and rewrite by translation. refine (convexFunctionOn_iff_segment_inequality (C := Set.univ) (f := fun x => f (x - a)) (hC := convex_univ) (hnotbot := hnotbot)).2 ?_ intro x hx y hy t ht0 ht1 have hseg := (convexFunctionOn_iff_segment_inequality (C := Set.univ) (f := f) (hC := convex_univ) (hnotbot := hf.2.2)).1 hf.1 (x - a) (by simp) (y - a) (by simp) t ht0 ht1 have hlin : ((1 - t) x + t y) - a = (1 - t) (x - a) + t (y - a) := by -- Affine combination commutes with translation. ext i simp [Pi.add_apply, Pi.sub_apply, Pi.smul_apply, sub_eq_add_neg, smul_eq_mul, add_mul] ring simpa [hlin] using hseg have hne : Set.Nonempty (epigraph (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) (fun x => f (x - a))) := by rcases hf.2.1 with p, hp have hp_mem : (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) p.1 f p.1 (p.2 : EReal) := by simpa [epigraph] using hp have hp' : f p.1 (p.2 : EReal) := hp_mem.2 refine (p.1 + a, p.2), ?_ refine And.intro (by trivial) ?_ simpa [add_sub_cancel] using hp' exact hconv, hne, hnotbot

The affine function is a proper convex function on Set.univ.{u} { : Type u} : Set Set.univ.

a) := by funext x simp [hfEq, hind x] -- From here one should: -- (1) replace `Q` by its symmetric part without changing `x Q x`, -- (2) diagonalize the resulting quadratic form by a linear equivalence `A`, -- (3) transport the direction submodule by `A`, -- and (4) collect linear/constant terms into `aStar` and ``. -- This is the remaining (nontrivial) linear-algebra step of Text 12.3.3. rcases linearMap_symmPart_dotProduct_preserves_quadratic (n := n) Q with Qs, hQs_symm, hQs_quad have hpsdQs : x : Fin n Real, 0 x Qs x := by intro x simpa [hQs_quad x] using hpsd x have hfEqQs : f = fun x => quadraticHalfLinear n Qs x + ((x b : Real) : EReal) + (c : EReal) + indicatorFunction (M.direction : Set (Fin n Real)) (x - Text 12.3.5: A function Unknown identifier `f`f on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n is symmetric with respect to all orthogonal transformations (rotationally symmetric) if and only if it has the form Unknown identifier `f`sorry = sorry : Propf x = Unknown identifier `g`g (x), for some function Unknown identifier `g`g on , where sorry : invalid occurrence of `` notation, it must be surrounded by parentheses (e.g. `( + 1)`) is the Euclidean norm.

Furthermore, for such an Unknown identifier `f`f, it is a closed proper convex function on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n if and only if Unknown identifier `g`g satisfies:

  1. Unknown identifier `g`g is convex on ;

  2. Unknown identifier `g`g is non-decreasing;

  3. Unknown identifier `g`g is lower semicontinuous;

  4. Unknown identifier `g`g 0 is finite.

def IsRotationallySymmetric { : Type*} (n : Nat) (f : (Fin n Real) ) : Prop := let eL : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) L[] (Fin n Real) := EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) O : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) [] EuclideanSpace (Fin n), x : Fin n Real, f (eL (O (eL.symm x))) = f x

The Euclidean norm on Fin sorry : TypeFin Unknown identifier `n`n , defined via the equivalence with EuclideanSpace.{u_7, u_8} ( : Type u_7) (n : Type u_8) : Type (max u_7 u_8)EuclideanSpace.

noncomputable def euclidNorm (n : Nat) (x : Fin n Real) : Real := (EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) ).symm x

In Euclidean space, vectors of equal norm are related by some linear isometry.

Text 12.3.5: Rotational symmetry is equivalent to depending only on the Euclidean norm.

theorem isRotationallySymmetric_iff_exists_norm_comp { : Type*} (n : Nat) (f : (Fin n Real) ) : IsRotationallySymmetric n f g : (Fin 1 Real) , x : Fin n Real, f x = g (fun _ : Fin 1 => euclidNorm n x) := by classical constructor intro hrot by_cases hn : n = 0 subst hn refine fun _ => f 0, ?_ intro x have hx : x = (0 : Fin 0 Real) := Subsingleton.elim x 0 subst hx simp have hn' : 0 < n := Nat.pos_of_ne_zero hn let eL : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) L[] (Fin n Real) := EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) have hrot' : O : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) [] EuclideanSpace (Fin n), x : Fin n Real, f (eL (O (eL.symm x))) = f x := by simpa [IsRotationallySymmetric, eL] using hrot let i0 : Fin n := 0, hn' let u0 : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) := EuclideanSpace.single i0 1 have hu0 : u0 = 1 := by simp [u0] refine fun r => f (eL ((r 0) u0)), ?_ intro x let ux : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) := eL.symm x let y : Fin n Real := eL ((ux : Real) u0) have hxy : ux = (ux : Real) u0 := by simp [hu0, norm_smul] rcases exists_linearIsometryEquiv_euclideanSpace_apply_eq_of_norm_eq (n := n) ux ((ux : Real) u0) hxy with O, hO calc f x = f (eL (O ux)) := by simpa [ux] using (hrot' O x).symm _ = f y := by simp [y, hO] _ = (fun r => f (eL ((r 0) u0))) (fun _ : Fin 1 => euclidNorm n x) := by simp [y, euclidNorm, ux, eL] rintro g, hg intro O x -- Unfold the definition and use invariance of `euclidNorm` under Euclidean isometries. classical let eL : EuclideanSpace (Fin n) L[] (Fin n Real) := EuclideanSpace.equiv (Fin n) have hnorm : euclidNorm n (eL (O (eL.symm x))) = euclidNorm n x := by simp [euclidNorm, eL, LinearIsometryEquiv.norm_map] rw [hg (eL (O (eL.symm x))), hg x] simp [hnorm]
